contentrichtext.text: {{Infobox Former Municipality Japan |Name= Kamo |JapaneseName= 加茂町 |MapImage= |Since=February 28, 2005 |Currently=[[Tsuyama, Okayama|Tsuyama]] |Region= [[Chūgoku region|Chūgoku]] |Prefecture=[[Okayama Prefecture|Okayama]] |District=[[Tomata District, Okayama|Tomata District]] |Area=159.27 |PopDate=2003 |Population=5,311 |Density=33.35 |Tree= [[Chamaecyparis obtusa]] |Flower= [[Satsuki azalea]] |Bird= [[Japanese Bush-warbler]] |Coord= {{coord|35|10|41.4|N|134|3|14.5|E}} |CityHallLink= }} [[File:Tsuyama city office Kamo branch.jpg|thumb|Former Kamo town hall]] {{nihongo|'''Kamo'''|加茂町|Kamo-chō}} was a [[towns of Japan|town]] located in [[Tomata District, Okayama|Tomata District]], [[Okayama Prefecture|Okayama]], [[Japan]]. On February 28, 2005 Kamo, along with the village of [[Aba, Okayama|Aba]], from [[Tomata District, Okayama|Tomata District]], the town of [[Shōboku, Okayama|Shōboku]], from [[Katsuta District, Okayama|Katsuta District]], and the town of [[Kume, Okayama|Kume]], from [[Kume District, Okayama|Kume District]], was merged into the expanded city of [[Tsuyama, Okayama|Tsuyama]] and no longer exists as an independent [[municipality of Japan|municipality]]. As of 2003, the town had an estimated [[population]] of 5,311 and a [[population density|density]] of 33.35 persons per km².
